snippet: A couple in Mississippi sued Exxon after discovering that the land they had planned to build their dream house on had been claimed already by dozens of alligators.
abstract: Centreville Journal; Mississippi couple Tom and Consandra Christmas sued Exxon in 2008 after discovering that land they had planned to build their dream house on in Centreville had been claimed already by dozens of alligators; Exxon owns neighboring property, which it has used as a waste dump, and brought in a menagerie of animals, including alligators, to serve as coal-mine canaries, their health intended to gauge the environmental health of the land.
lead_paragraph: A couple in Mississippi sued Exxon after discovering that the land they had planned to build their dream house on had been claimed already by dozens of alligators.

headline.main: Alligators Turn a Couple’s Dream Into a Court Fight
headline.print_headline: Alligators Turn a Couple’s Dream Into a Court Fight
